title: mirketue
author: mirketue
created_time: April 14, 2023, 08:37:12 PMLast edit: April 18, 2023, 02:26:06 AM by mirketue
content: Hello everyone, I would never have thought that I would be complaining about Stake due to it having a good reputation.But recently they put my account in ''Withdrawal only'' mode, but the problem is that I still can't withdraw or bet, how is it ''Withdrawal only'' mode? if the user can not withdraw?A support agent told me that I had problems with clause 4 of the ToS regarding KYC, but when I asked again he couldn't tell me if this was the reason I couldn't withdraw.Today they solved the problem thank you all tô follow up

comments.author: Saisher
comments.body: First, you need to follow the right format when creating a scam accusation just use this format without providing enough information about your case you cannot validate your accusation additionally post screenshots of the email or your chat with the support, contact the official representative here to make aware of the accusation StunnaCode:[b][color=black]What happened:: [/color][/b][b][color=black]Scammers Profile Link: [/color][/b][b][color=black]Reference Link: [/color][/b][b][color=black]Amount Scammed: [/color][/b][b][color=black]Payment Method: [/color][/b][b][color=black]Proof of Payment: [/color][/b][b][color=black]PM/Chat Logs: [/color][/b][b][color=black]Additional Notes: [/color][/b]

comments.author: acroman08
comments.body: seems like they are asking you to do KYC and the only way to proceed here if you want to get your deposit/winnings is to do their KYC. I've seen a similar case in the past where stake.com put the account of a gambler into "withdraw only mode" ask them to undergo a KYC procedure. Quote from: https://stake.com/policies/terms4. Know your Customer ("KYC")Stake reserves the right, at any time, to ask for any KYC documentation it deems necessary to determine the identity and location of a User. Stake reserves the right to restrict the Service, payment or withdrawal until identity is sufficiently determined, or for any other reason in Stake's sole discretion. Stake also reserves the right to disclose a User's information as appropriate to comply with legal process or as otherwise permitted by the privacy policy of Stake (owner and operator of Stake), and by using the Service, you acknowledge and consent to the possibility of such disclosure.

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: You've already posted this on their thread, just wait until they give you a response before you make another thread, especially in the scam accusations board. Their support is quite active so I doubt you need to wait that long. If that doesn't solve your problem and they did something that looks like a scammy move, you can bump this thread and post more details about it.

comments.author: shasan
comments.body: Quote from: mirketue on April 14, 2023, 08:37:12 PMHello everyone, I would never have thought that I would be complaining about Stake due to it having a good reputation.But recently they put my account in ''Withdrawal only'' mode, but the problem is that I still can't withdraw or bet, how is it ''Withdrawal only'' mode? if the user can not withdraw?A support agent told me that I had problems with clause 4 of the ToS regarding KYC, but when I asked again he couldn't tell me if this was the reason I couldn't withdraw.Anyway, I don't know how to proceed and it's a complete mess for a casino of this sizeIf there is anyone who has had experience with this matter or any agent wants to help me .. thanks for the helpYou have withdrawn only mode means you can not operate anything except withdraw. But you can not withdraw as the fund is on hold by the site due to the KYC process. To withdraw funds you have to pass their KYC to avoid money laundering and abuse or something like that.

comments.author: WhyStakeWhy
comments.body: OP,I might be able to help you but first1) What is your VIP level?  (Plat, Plat 2)2) How much are you trying to withdrawl?

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: Quote from: WhyStakeWhy on April 15, 2023, 03:03:15 PMOP,I might be able to help you but firstI doubt the capacity of a third party to help recover the op's case because I think it can only be done by stake.com's KYC department that the op needs to complete first.Stunna's help should be more credible than the offerings of other users on this site.

comments.author: holydarkness
comments.body: Quote from: WhyStakeWhy on April 15, 2023, 03:03:15 PMOP,I might be able to help you but first1) What is your VIP level?  (Plat, Plat 2)2) How much are you trying to withdrawl?Like what? Fake KYC? Or to send the amount they tried to WD to you? Or relinguishing their locked account to you?OP, I am strongly suggest you to stay away from this user above. I don't think whatever they offered to help is within the realm of acceptable by Stake. Like noorman0 said, Stunna's help will be more credible. Try to reach them.

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: WhyStakeWhy on April 15, 2023, 03:03:15 PMOP,I might be able to help you but firstAnd who are you?I doubt you are anyone from Stake. It's known to everyone who are official from Stake. I am going to leave a negative on your profile until you provide some vouch from any official of Stake.Right now the red flag is, you are here to imposter stake officials.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: WhyStakeWhy on April 15, 2023, 03:03:15 PMOP,I might be able to help you but first1) What is your VIP level?  (Plat, Plat 2)2) How much are you trying to withdrawl?So you created an account today and the first thread you say was this and start off by asking the complainants details? You are clearly a scammer looking to capitalize on OP's situationLet me guess, you are going to ask him a service fee advance, so you will "help him unlock his account" which of course you are not going to do.

comments.author: robelneo
comments.body: Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on April 15, 2023, 11:21:39 PMQuote from: WhyStakeWhy on April 15, 2023, 03:03:15 PMOP,I might be able to help you but first1) What is your VIP level?  (Plat, Plat 2)2) How much are you trying to withdrawl?So you created an account today and the first thread you say was this and start off by asking the complainants details? You are clearly a scammer looking to capitalize on OP's situationLet me guess, you are going to ask him a service fee advance, so you will "help him unlock his account" which of course you are not going to do.We here can only offer suggestions and recommendations but this guy @WhyStakeWhy is offering help, what he can possibly do but all those you've mentioned and may I add he may try to deceive OP that he is part of the Stake support team and could ask OP's details.Whatever his intentions are I advise OP to be wise not to fall into this, only the support team can answer, address and solve your issue, and don't trust outsiders.

comments.author: shasan
comments.body: Quote from: WhyStakeWhy on April 15, 2023, 03:03:15 PMOP,I might be able to help you but first1) What is your VIP level?  (Plat, Plat 2)2) How much are you trying to withdrawl?@Op never trusts this user. I think this user is a probable scammer who may take info and try to scam you. Cause stake.com will not allow third parties to interfere with you. And also this person has only a single post which is regarding helping you. It seems to me that this person has an alternative account and this account has been created to scam people.
